title: Rishi Sunak reportedly considering calling General election in May
description: The Prime Minister is considering calling a General election in May, a report has claimed. It follows two by-election defeats for the Conservatives where Labour overturned huge majorities to take the former Tory seats. MPs are considering a May election to ...

title: Laura Kuenssberg pinpoints 'important evidence' over threat of Nigel Farage and Reform UK
description: While recent by-elections may on the surface appear to be Labour victories, the specifics of the votes reveal Reform UK could be increasing their hold over British politics.

title: Tories eye up May election to 'stop the bleeding' and head off mutiny against Rishi Sunak
description: Senior Tory source says May election might be necessary after Labour battering in by-elections and polls suggesting the party will be 'obliterated' with announcement potentially soon

title: Sunak must embrace traditional Conservative values for Tories to win election, poll suggests
description: Poll likely to fuel concerns over Rishi Sunak’s leadership as Labour leads with 22 percentage points over Conservatives

title: Conservatives face 'extinction' unless they change course, warns top Tory
description: To be clear, what Rishi Sunak and the Conservatives are facing is a potential extinction event rather than a defeat. What makes this political implosion all the more remarkable, is that no one I speak to in my Red Wall constituency of Rossendale and Darwen in Lancashire seems to even like Keir Stammer or be clamouring for a Labour Government.

title: UK in a ‘doom loop’ under Tories, Labour MP claims
description: Shadow financial secretary to the Treasury James Murray said public services across the country were ‘on their knees’.

description: In the immediate aftermath of their dual implosion in Kingswood and Wellingborough, Tory MPs were dispatched to put a brave public face on the results.

title: If Rishi Sunak is going to lose, what should he do in the next nine months?
description: The prime minister could do the right things, which would mean no tax cuts, writes John Rentoul... but will he?

title: Rishi Sunak urges Right to come together after by-election losses
description: And if they are defeated in both Wellingborough and Kingswood, it would be the third time that two by-elections have been lost on the same day during Rishi Sunak’s premiership. The Tory majority in Kingswood is 11,200, while Wellingborough has a majority of 18,540.

title: Sunak urges right-leaning voters to unite to keep Starmer out of No 10
description: Prime minister calls for unity after heavy losses to Labour and Reform UK electoral gains

title: ‘We’re f**king up so much’: No 10 despair after Tories’ double defeat
description: But in the immediate aftermath of the Tories’ double defeat, there was little evidence of any serious manoeuvres against Sunak. How long that will hold remains to be seen, particularly if next month’s Budget fails to shift the polls and flights to Rwanda do not take off.

title: CLA poll finds labour takes lead among rural voters
description: LABOUR has taken a narrow lead over the Conservatives among England’s rural voters, a poll has found. But while the survey suggests Conservative support has collapsed in the party’s heartlands, the head of a major countryside business association said rural voters were still “politically homeless”.

title: Week-in-Review: Rishi Sunak is stuck in a political doom loop

title: Christian-nation idea fuels US conservative causes, but historians say it misreads founders' intent
description: The Declaration of Independence famously proclaims that people’s rights come from a “Creator” and “Nature’s God” — but doesn’t specify who that is. Already such views are being voiced by supporters of Donald Trump amid his bid to recapture the presidency.

title: Rishi Sunak in desperate call to British conservatives after by-election losses
description: Rishi Sunak has called on all those on the right of politics to "come together" – over him - after disastrous double defeats in the Wellingborough and Kingswood by-elections. The Tories lost votes to Labour and a strengthened Reform UK, the successor to Nigel Farage ’s Brexit Party.

title: "Grim" By-Election Defeats Leave Rishi Sunak Battling Crushed Tory Morale

title: Wellingborough by-election: Five things we learned
description: The dust has settled, 30,000-odd votes have been counted and Wellingborough has a new MP. The election was called after a recall petition ousted the former member Peter Bone, whose partner was chosen as the Conservative candidate. But what have we learned during the Northamptonshire constituency's by-election?

title: Starmer sitting pretty as chances for Tories are bitty
description: Sir Keir Starmer is playing it cool. He would only go as far as to say that his party is a “credible contender” for power. Those in Labour who study the numbers closely are less hesitant: they know that, as things stand, Sir Keir could win a majority as big as Tony Blair’s was in 1997.

title: YASMIN QURESHI: Bolton Council forced to make hard choices
description: I do not envy local councillors having to make these decisions. Locally and nationally, Conservatives have tried to argue that the decisions forced upon Bolton Council are not inevitable and that there are other options. This is not true. Bolton Council ...

title: Only way is down for terrible Tories following recent by-election defeats
description: The manner of their recent losses shows that the Conservatives are now 'unfit to govern and out of ideas,' says Record View.

title: Labour’s Lead Is Firm, Reform Gains: Five Lessons From the By-Elections
description: The Labour Party handed the governing Conservatives two thumping defeats in a pair of special elections on Thursday in a setback for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak that reinforces the sense that the opposition is on course to win power at a general election due in the next year.

title: The places in Wales with three-week or monthly black bin collections and the ones that could introduce it next
description: Most areas of Wales could have their black bins collected every three or four weeks as councils try to cut service costs amid a £432m funding gap
